meanings.definition: A person or thing that ticks.
meanings.sent1: The old grandfather clock was a reliable ticker, marking the passage of time with each tick.
meanings.sent2: I can hear the ticker of the kitchen timer counting down to when the cookies will be ready.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten thought the metronome was a fun ticker to play with.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat like a fast ticker during the thrilling roller coaster ride.
meanings.sent5: The antique pocket watch was a beautiful ticker, its rhythmic ticking soothing to the ears.

meanings.sent1: Every morning, the old ticker on the mantle chimed to wake up the household.
meanings.sent2: She glanced at the ticker on her wrist to check the time before the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her toy phone was a magical ticker that could stop time.
meanings.sent4: The ancient sundial served as a natural ticker, casting shadows to tell the time.
meanings.sent5: The cuckoo clock was a charming ticker, announcing each hour with a cheerful chirp.

meanings.definition: A device for receiving stock market quotations.
meanings.sent1: The financial analyst constantly checked the ticker for the latest stock prices.
meanings.sent2: Investors rely on the electronic ticker to stay updated on market trends.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the scrolling news ticker on the TV for a stock market ticker.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were glued to the ticker, watching the numbers fluctuate with each trade.
meanings.sent5: The digital ticker displayed the market data in real-time, helping traders make informed decisions.
